meanings.definition: To utter a short, sharp bark or cry.
meanings.sent1: The small dog yipped happily when its owner returned home.
meanings.sent2: The puppy yipped excitedly during playtime in the park.
meanings.sent3: The little dog yipped at the mailman, thinking he was a new friend.
meanings.sent4: The firework yipped through the night sky, startling the birds.
meanings.sent5: The child yipped with joy as they rode the roller coaster.

meanings.definition: A short, sharp bark or cry.
meanings.sent1: The yip of the puppy was heard throughout the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The yip of the small dog alerted us to the visitor at the door.
meanings.sent3: The yip of the squirrel made the cat curious about the noise outside.
meanings.sent4: The yip of the coyote echoed in the silent forest, sending shivers down our spines.
meanings.sent5: The yip of the fox was a haunting sound in the darkness of the night.
